[@id:225329]
[%Nr. 2066]
[!**Beende die Sätze. Wähle jeweils die richtige Wortgruppe aus.**]
1. The teacher will not be happy [+if we forget our homework again.][-if we forgot our homework again.][-if we had forgotten our homework again]
2. My uncle would stay longer in York [-if he had had more time.][+if he had more time.][-if he has more time.]
3. If he studied the new words, [-he can get a good mark in the test.][+he could get a good mark in the test.][-he could have got a good mark in the test.]

options.text: if we forget our homework again.
if we forgot our homework again.
if we had forgotten our homework again
if he had had more time.
he can get a good mark in the test.
he could get a good mark in the test.
he could have got a good mark in the test.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:225331]
[%Nr. 2066]
[!**Um welchen Typ der if-Sätze handelt es sich?**]
1. My parents would have bought the house if it had been cheaper.
[-Typ I (Bedingung erfüllbar)][-Typ II (Bedingung theoretisch erfüllbar)][+Typ III (Bedingung nicht mehr erfüllbar)]

2. She would be very happy if her friends came.
[-Typ I (Bedingung erfüllbar)][+Typ II (Bedingung theoretisch erfüllbar)][-Typ III (Bedingung nicht mehr erfüllbar)]

3. Daniel would have been home on time if the bus had come.
[-Typ I (Bedingung erfüllbar)][-Typ II (Bedingung theoretisch erfüllbar)][+Typ III (Bedingung nicht mehr erfüllbar)]
